When restarting Eclipse (after removal of the repositoryConfigurations file), I didn't find any planning/query/repository information (correct, I think), but I wasn't able to re-create repository connections.

So, I re-restarted Eclipse, getting back all my queries/planning/repository information. Perfect!

Problem solved, thank you!

Glad that it worked, but not quite perfect on our end ;)  Rob, can you fix up that logging code and try to figure out why the Status object we're creating is getting an invalid param?  Also, should the exception handling there re-create the file if it fails to read or write it?

Logging now will post the name of exception class if the exception doesn't have a message (source of the invalid parameter).
If an exception occurs while reading the file, the file is deleted and will be re-created upon workbench shutdown.
